name: Avoid Artifacts with excessive lines of code (PHP)
description: This rule searches for all the artifacts with excessive lines of code including comments. Artifacts being checked including methods, functions and constructor. An artifact with more than 100 lines of code is considered as violation.
output:
This report lists all the artifacts with excessive lines of code.

This QR provides the following information:
- Artifact full name.
rationale: Artifact with excessive lines of code indicates that it has lot of operations to perform and therefore will be difficult to understand and maintain.
remediation: Refactor the code to reduce the number of code lines in an artifact.

qualityStandards.name: Source Element Excessive Size
qualityStandards.description:
Objective
Avoid over-sizing of software elements

Consequence
Software that does not follow the principles of modularity causes excessive propagation of modification impacts

Measure Element
Number of instances where a file has too many lines of code based on a threshold value. The default threshold value for number of lines of code is 1000
